intro: Malvastrum mollendoense, commonly known as the mollendoense mallow, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
